review.des:
Beautiful ambiance with very nice moo lighting.
The service on a Friday night was retry good, all of the servers and waiters were attentive and made recommendations based on our varying interests.
Try their maple honey fried chicken!! So good!!! Not quite $17 good, but still good if you don't mind spending the money.

I've been to this place multiple times even during team lunches since I work nearby. Literally right next to this place. I would definitely give 5 stars but yesterday's experience just made me feel uncomfortable. The waitress forgot an order which I can totally understand, it happens! Its a busy place and hour! But her attitude was not something I could understand. First she threw the napkins at our table, making me feel like she didn't want to work today or something. After that everything about her attitude seemed very negative to me. We had to cancel one of our orders because she didn't forgot to take them but I guess she was told off by her manager because after we cancelled our order she suddenly tried to make up for it by suddenly acting nice and caring. Anyways still gave her nice tip because maybe she was having a bad day. But please don't throw things on the table, its really rude. Honestly me writing one review won't do anything much but if the waitress at least sees this review i just hope you understand that throwing things on the table really makes customers feel uncomfortable. Thanks!

The Dearborn is the best restaurant and bar in the State Street District! My favorites are the maple glazed fried chicken, shrimp and octopus, the signature burger and the snickers dessert. The owners are extremely hands on and never fail to greet regulars with a warm welcome. The vibe here is fun, upbeat, has open windows in the summer and always a great crowd. Their beverage program is cutting edge and sure to please the most discerning pallet.

Prime location in downtown Chicago.

The hangar steak  with polenta is die for! I wasn't even craving anything particular but this dish hit the spot like an 7-year itch had been scratched! The au jus is heavenly...I kept trying to "dip" all of my food to stain it with the flavor.

The local choice salad was better heard than eaten. Kind of reminded me of the basic garden variety salad spring mix in the bag. The dressing wasn't particularly special or especially well designed to be a pairing.

The eloté is a deconstructed Mexican street corn and it's good but it is better left in it's constructed form.

Server was very informative but the rest of the staff are sort of lackluster.

The oysters were good and fresh.

Oh, NO PIE  UNTIL SPRING.

This place is a really nice place and good atmosphere.  It's such a shame the service was so terrible.
We arrived and they originally sat us at a tall table.  Im shorter and asked to move tables because my feet were going to dangle.  Not a problem they accommodated and we're nice about it.  We were seated at another table.  The waiter came to our table three times and we were at dinner for over an hour.  Once to take drink order when we sat down, again to take our meal order and then to bring us our bill.
We watched as he joked around with the tables around us and even refilled their water glasses and he never once approached our table.  Our table was 10 feet from the other table.
It's sad that if you are not a family of 4 or more that you are not given the same attention and service being a younger couple just wanting to have dinner.

I'm hoping that the waiter learned a lesson or even a personality as I even went against my better judgement and still left over 20% tip as I understand working in the service industry and tips are everything.

So this is a cool spot to hang out but truthfully the food is not that impressive. I think the thing that stood out the most was that our food came out five minutes after we ordered it. So we got appetizers within five minutes and then we got our food within five minutes after we ordered it after we had finished our appetizers.

So the food was premade in on a scale to 1 to 10 it was about a six.

Wow - so good! We made a reservation via Open Table (around 5pm for a 9:15pm) table for two. We got here a little early but only waited a few minutes before being seated. Our server did take a little while to stop by our table (he may be new? Our neighbors received a wrong dish and then he broke a wine glass...), but the neighboring server took great care of us!

Their drink menu greatly outweighs their food menu. There are lots of great signatures mixed drinks plus an extensive wine and beer list as well. I  disappointed that the bread starter was sold out, but it makes sense since it was so late.

Our food arrived 10 minutes after we ordered, so I'm glad we didn't end up with a starter. I ordered the wedge salad (SO GOOD) and a side of brussel sprouts (which is shareable size!) My friend ordered the bone-in short ribs, as suggested by our waiter. All was wonderful!

We also splurged for dessert. I highly recommend the churros - warm and delicious! Same goes for the coffee.

All in all, you can't go wrong! Great quality and healthy portions for the price point. I only wish our server had been more attentive...
Shrimp tacos were super tasty. Service was great, super friendly staff. Was seated very quickly on a Friday night. Be prepared to pay for a $$$ for appetizers and especially entrees.
Amazing food.  Definitely start with the pork belly.  I had the rabbit, which was amazing and the wife had the duck.  Pricey but definitely worth it!
